meanings.definition: Not reflexive; not relating to oneself.
meanings.sent1: The mirror showed an irreflexive image of the room, without any reflection of myself.
meanings.sent2: She made an irreflexive decision without considering how it would affect her.
meanings.sent3: It's like an irreflexive puzzle where the pieces don't connect to each other.
meanings.sent4: His actions were as irreflexive as a robot following programmed instructions.
meanings.sent5: The painting captured an irreflexive moment frozen in time.

meanings.sent1: He was so irreflexive that he never stopped to think about his own feelings.
meanings.sent2: The irreflexive student never questioned his own beliefs.
meanings.sent3: Her irreflexive behavior led to many misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: The storm was an irreflexive force of nature, not caring about the damage it caused.
meanings.sent5: The character's irreflexive nature made him unpredictable in his actions.
